comments.author: inonit@inonit.com
comments.body: I notice 1.6R5 is there now.  Is this bug "fixed?"  If not, do you have suggestions on the best way to do it?

comments.author: julien.ponge@gmail.com
comments.body: I confirm that this has been fixed now, there must have been some lag when I reported this :-)

comments.author: norrisboyd@gmail.com
comments.body: Adding target milestone of 1.6R6 based on the date this bug was resolved FIXED.

description:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1) Gecko/20061010 Firefox/2.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1) Gecko/20061010 Firefox/2.0

The latest version of Rhino that is available through the Maven2 repositories is 1.6R3: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/rhino/js/. New releases of Rhino should be made quickly available though the Maven2 repositories, as a growing base of projects use Maven2 and gather their dependencies through it.

Reproducible: Always
summary: Rhino 1.6R4 is not available from the Maven2 repositories
